sub_topic: Identifying the hybridization of an atom in a molecule
message_1: What is the hybridization of oxygen in the molecule H2O?
message_2: The hybridization of oxygen in the H2O molecule is sp3. In H2O, oxygen has two lone pairs and two bond pairs, making a total of four electron domains. This corresponds to an sp3 hybridization, where one s orbital and three p orbitals combine to form four sp3 hybrid orbitals.
